Although the annexation resolution avoided specifying Texas's boundaries, the U.S. inherited Texas's unenforced claims to [[South Texas]], [[West Texas]], over half of [[New Mexico]], a third of [[Colorado]], and small parts of [[Oklahoma]], [[Kansas]] and [[Wyoming]]. With Texas joining the union, [[Arkansas]] finally gave up its claim on [[Miller County, Arkansas Territory|Miller County]]. {{Clear}}
==1846== [[File:Non-Native American Nations Control over N America 1846.png|180px|right|alt=Map showing Non-Native American Nations Control over N America c. 1846]] ;January 1, 1846 The state of [[Yucatán (state)|Yucatán]] declares independence, for the same reasons as the [[Republic of Texas]] and [[Republic of the Rio Grande]], forming the [[Republic of Yucatán]].<ref name="Mexico.statoids"/> ;June 14, 1846 The [[California Republic]], also called the '''Bear Flag Republic''', was proclaimed by settlers in [[Sonoma, California|Sonoma]] in the then-[[History of California to 1899|Mexican province of California]]. Declared during the [[Mexican–American War]], the republic lasted less than a month.{{#tag:ref|Not shown on the map as the Republic only lasted under a month |group="A"}}<ref name="sfmuseum.CA">{{cite web |year= 2009 |url = http://www.sfmuseum.org/hist6/toddflag.html|title = The California Bear Flag|publisher = sfmuseum.org| accessdate = November 14, 2009 | last= |quote=}}</ref> ;June 18, 1846 The [[Oregon Treaty]] established the [[49th parallel north|49th parallel]] west of the Lake of the Woods as the continental border (so it did not include [[Vancouver Island]]) with the lands held by the United Kingdom. The sharing of [[Oregon Country]] ended, and the American portion becomes unorganized territory.<ref>{{cite web |url = http://www.yale.edu/lawweb/avalon/diplomacy/britain/br-1846.htm |title = Text of "Treaty with Great Britain, in Regard to Limits Westward of the Rocky Mountains." |publisher = The Avalon Project at Yale Law School |accessdate = 2006-08-04 |deadurl = yes |archiveurl = https://web.archive.org/web/20060825094642/http://www.yale.edu/lawweb/avalon/diplomacy/britain/br-1846.htm |archivedate = 2006-08-25 |df = }}</ref>
;December 28, 1846 The southeast portion of [[Iowa Territory]] was admitted to the US as the 29th state, [[Iowa]]. The remainder became unorganized.<ref name="NWT" /> {{Clear}}
==1848== [[File:Non-Native American Nations Control over N America 1848.png|180px|right|alt=Map showing Non-Native American Nations Control over N America c. 1848]] ;February 2, 1848 The [[Treaty of Guadalupe Hidalgo]] ended the [[Mexican–American War]]. Mexico ceded the Texas-claimed areas as well as a [[Mexican Cession|large area of land]]<ref>{{cite web |url = http://www.yale.edu/lawweb/avalon/diplomacy/mexico/guadhida.htm |title = Text of "Treaty of Guadalupe Hidalgo" |publisher = The Avalon Project at Yale Law School |accessdate = 2006-08-04 |deadurl = yes |archiveurl = https://web.archive.org/web/20060804142144/http://www.yale.edu/lawweb/avalon/diplomacy/mexico/guadhida.htm |archivedate = 2006-08-04 |df = }}</ref> consisting of all of present-day [[California]], [[Nevada]], and [[Utah]], most of [[Arizona]], and portions of [[Colorado]], [[New Mexico]], and [[Wyoming]].
;August 17, 1848 The [[Republic of Yucatán]] rejoined Mexico after the [[Caste War of Yucatán]] forced them to seek outside help.<ref name="Mexico.statoids"/>
;May 29, 1848 The southeastern portion of [[Wisconsin Territory]] was admitted to the US as the 30th state, [[Wisconsin]]. The remainder became unorganized.<ref name="NWT" />
;August 14, 1848 [[Oregon Territory]] was organized, including present-day [[Idaho]], northwestern [[Montana]], [[Oregon]], [[Washington (state)|Washington]], and western [[Wyoming]].<ref>{{cite web |url=http://lcweb2.loc.gov/ammem/today/aug14.html |title=Today in History: August 14 |publisher=Library of Congress |accessdate=2006-08-04}}</ref>
{{Clear}}
==1849== [[File:Non-Native American Nations Control over N America 1849.png|180px|right|alt=Map showing Non-Native American Nations Control over N America c. 1849]] ;January 13, 1849 [[Colony of Vancouver Island]] is formed as a British [[crown colony]]. ;March 3, 1849 [[Minnesota Territory]] was organized, consisting of present-day [[Minnesota]], and eastern portions of [[North Dakota]] and [[South Dakota]].<ref>{{cite web |url = http://www.sos.state.mn.us/student/act1849.pdf |title = An Act to Establish the Territorial Government of Minnesota |accessdate = 2006-08-04 |format = PDF |page = 4 |deadurl = yes |archiveurl = https://web.archive.org/web/20060803011308/http://www.sos.state.mn.us/student/act1849.pdf |archivedate = 2006-08-03 |df = }}</ref> {{Clear}}
==1850== [[File:Non-Native American Nations Control over N America 1850.png|180px|right|alt=Map showing Non-Native American Nations Control over N America c. 1850]] ;September 9, 1850 The [[Compromise of 1850]] divided the [[Mexican Cession]] and land claimed by [[Texas]] but ceded to the federal government in exchange for taking on its debts. The western portion was admitted to the US as the 31st state, [[California]], most of the rest was organized as [[Utah Territory]] and [[New Mexico Territory]], and a small portion became unorganized land.<ref>{{cite web |url=http://ourdocuments.gov/print_friendly.php?flash=false&page=transcript&doc=27&title=Transcript+of+Compromise+of+1850+(1850) |title=Transcript of Compromise of 1850 |accessdate=2006-08-04}}</ref> New Mexico Territory consisted of most of present-day [[Arizona]] and [[New Mexico]], as well as a southern portion of [[Colorado]] and the southern tip of [[Nevada]]. Utah Territory consisted of present-day [[Utah]], most of Nevada, and portions of Colorado and [[Wyoming]]. {{Clear}}
==1853== [[File:Non-Native American Nations Control over N America 1853.png|180px|right|alt=Map showing Non-Native American Nations Control over N America c. 1853]] ;March 2, 1853 [[Washington Territory]] was split from [[Oregon Territory]], consisting of present-day [[Washington (state)|Washington]], northern [[Idaho]], and the western tip of [[Montana]], leaving Oregon Territory with all of [[Oregon]], southern Idaho and a portion of [[Wyoming]].<ref>{{cite web |url=http://columbia.washingtonhistory.org/magazine/articles/2003/0303/0303-a4.aspx |title=The Creation of Washington Territory |publisher=Whshington State Historical Society |accessdate=2009-09-01}}</ref>
;December 30, 1853 The [[Gadsden Purchase]] added some land to [[New Mexico Territory]], corresponding to the southernmost areas of present-day [[Arizona]] and [[New Mexico]].<ref>{{cite web |url = http://www.yale.edu/lawweb/avalon/diplomacy/mexico/mx1853.htm |title = Text of "Gadsden Purchase Treaty" |publisher = The Avalon Project at Yale Law School |accessdate = 2006-08-04 |deadurl = yes |archiveurl = https://web.archive.org/web/20060819180030/http://www.yale.edu/lawweb/avalon/diplomacy/mexico/mx1853.htm |archivedate = 2006-08-19 |df = }}</ref> {{Clear}}
==May 30, 1854== [[File:Non-Native American Nations Control over N America 1854.png|180px|right|alt=Map showing Non-Native American Nations Control over N America c. 1854]] [[Kansas Territory]] and [[Nebraska Territory]] were organized; the remaining unorganized land colloquially became known as [[Indian Territory]].<ref>{{cite web |url = http://www.yale.edu/lawweb/avalon/kanneb.htm |title = Text of "An Act to Organize the Territories of Nebraska and Kansas." |publisher = The Avalon Project at Yale Law School |accessdate = 2006-08-04 |deadurl = yes |archiveurl = https://web.archive.org/web/20060805095755/http://www.yale.edu/lawweb/avalon/kanneb.htm |archivedate = 2006-08-05 |df = }}</ref> Kansas Territory consisted of present-day [[Kansas]] and eastern [[Colorado]]. Nebraska Territory consisted of present-day [[Nebraska]], and parts of [[Colorado]], [[Montana]], [[North Dakota]], [[South Dakota]], and [[Wyoming]]. Indian Territory corresponds to eastern [[Oklahoma]].
A peculiarity appeared at this time, when a small strip of land north of Texas was not officially assigned by any state or territory; this came to be called the [[Neutral Strip (Oklahoma)|Neutral Strip]] or "No Man's Land", which corresponds to the present-day [[Salient (geography)|panhandle]] of [[Oklahoma]].<ref>{{cite web |url = http://digital.library.okstate.edu/encyclopedia/entries/N/NO001.html |title = NO MAN'S LAND |publisher = Oklahoma Historical Society |accessdate = 2009-09-01 |deadurl = yes |archiveurl = https://web.archive.org/web/20130117093352/http://digital.library.okstate.edu/encyclopedia/entries/N/NO001.html |archivedate = 2013-01-17 |df = }}</ref>
{{Clear}}
==February 12, 1857== [[File:Non-Native American Nations Control over N America 1857.png|180px|right|alt=Map showing Non-Native American Nations Control over N America c. 1857]] The [[1857 Constitution of Mexico]] was adopted, reorganizing some states. [[Nuevo León]] is merged into [[Coahuila]]; [[Aguascalientes]], [[Colima]], and [[Tlaxcala]] all had their status changed from territory to state; and the state of [[Guerrero]] was created from portions of [[México (state)|México]] and [[Puebla]].<ref name="Mexico.statoids"/> {{Clear}}
==1858== [[File:Non-Native American Nations Control over N America 1858.png|180px|right|alt=Map showing Non-Native American Nations Control over N America c. 1858]] ;August 2, 1858 The [[Colony of British Columbia]] was a [[crown colony]] in [[British North America]] from 1858 until 1871.<ref name="thecanadianencyclopedia.A1ARTA0000995">{{cite web |year= 2009 |url = http://www.thecanadianencyclopedia.com/en/timelines/british-columbia/|title = British Columbia|publisher = The Canadian Encyclopedia © 2009 Historica-Dominion| accessdate = November 14, 2009 | last= |quote=}}</ref>
;May 11, 1858 The eastern portion of [[Minnesota Territory]] was admitted to the US as the 32nd state, [[Minnesota]]. The remainder became unorganized.<ref name="NWT" /> {{Clear}}
==1859== [[File:Non-Native American Nations Control over N America 1859.png|180px|right|alt=Map showing Non-Native American Nations Control over N America c. 1859]] ;February 14, 1859 The western portion of [[Oregon Territory]] was admitted to the US as the 33rd state, [[Oregon]]. The remainder was assigned to [[Washington Territory]].<ref>{{cite web |url = http://www.oregonriverrights.com/admissions_act.htm |title = Text of "Act of Congress Admitting Oregon into Union" |accessdate = 2006-08-04 |deadurl = yes |archiveurl = https://web.archive.org/web/20060811193225/http://www.oregonriverrights.com/admissions_act.htm |archivedate = 2006-08-11 |df = }}</ref> ;1859 A boundary commission was set up to delineate the border between Vancouver Island and the Washington State coast. The commission could not come to agreement on where the middle of the Strait was so in 1859 things came to a head during the bloodless [[Pig War (1859)|Pig War]].<ref name="Barman p. 75">{{harvnb|Barman|1996|p=75}}</ref>
{{Clear}}
==1861== [[File:Non-Native American Nations Control over N America 1861.png|180px|right|alt=Map showing Non-Native American Nations Control over N America c. 1861]] ;January 29, 1861 The eastern portion of [[Kansas Territory]] was admitted as the 34th state, [[Kansas]]. The western portion was added to [[Colorado Territory]] on February 28, 1861, but for the month between statehood for Kansas and the formation of Colorado Territory, it appears to have had no official status.<ref name="Colorado">{{cite web |url=http://www.colorado.gov/dpa/doit/archives/arcgov.html |title=Colorado Government |accessdate=2006-08-04}}</ref>
;March 4, 1861 The [[Confederate States of America]] (CSA) was formed. The [[Southern United States|Southern states]] [[Ordinance of Secession|seceded]] at different dates and joined the CSA at different dates; to simplify the map, only the final form of the CSA is shown here. There were [[American Civil War|rebel governments]] as well as [[Union (American Civil War)|Union]] governments in [[Kentucky]] and [[Missouri]], and the CSA had full control over [[Indian Territory]]. To view a detailed animated map depicting the various state secessions see [[:Image:CSA states evolution.gif|CSA states evolution]].<ref name="state.gov.17609">{{cite web |year= 2009 |url = https://www.state.gov/r/pa/ho/time/cw/17609.htm|title = Preventing Diplomatic Recognition of the Confederacy, 1861–1865|publisher = [[USA.gov]]| accessdate = November 14, 2009 | last= |quote=}}</ref> ;February 28, 1861 [[Colorado Territory]] was organized, with land from [[Utah Territory|Utah]], [[New Mexico Territory|New Mexico]], and [[Nebraska Territory|Nebraska]] Territories, as well as the land left over from [[Kansas Territory]]; it corresponded already to present-day [[Colorado]].<ref name="Colorado" /> Also, the eastern tip of [[Washington Territory]] was transferred to [[Nebraska Territory]]. {{Clear}}
==July 14, 1862== [[File:Non-Native American Nations Control over N America 1862.png|180px|right|alt=Map showing Non-Native American Nations Control over N America c. 1862]] Due to its nature as a mining and grazing area, land started to be added to [[Nevada Territory]] to accommodate these activities. Its eastern border was moved eastward from the 39th [[Washington Meridian|meridian west from Washington]], to the 38th [[Washington Meridian|meridian west from Washington]], transferring the land from [[Utah Territory]].<ref name="Nevada">{{cite web |url = http://www.nevadaobserver.com/Reading%20Room%20Documents/Nevada%20-%20Adjustment%20of%20the%20Boundaries%20(1912).htm |title = The History of Nevada: The Adjustment of the Boundaries of Nevada |accessdate = 2006-08-04 |deadurl = yes |archiveurl = https://web.archive.org/web/20060829105825/http://www.nevadaobserver.com/Reading%20Room%20Documents/Nevada%20-%20Adjustment%20of%20the%20Boundaries%20%281912%29.htm |archivedate = 2006-08-29 |df = }}</ref> {{Clear}}
==1863== [[File:Non-Native American Nations Control over N America 1863.png|180px|right|alt=Map showing Non-Native American Nations Control over N America c. 1863]] ;April 29, 1863 The Mexican state of [[Campeche]] was split from [[Yucatán (state)|Yucatán]].<ref name="Mexico.statoids"/>
;February 24, 1863 The Union created its own [[Arizona Territory]], splitting it off from [[New Mexico Territory]], making both territories correspond to their present-day states, except for Arizona Territory including the southern tip of present-day [[Nevada]].<ref>{{cite web |url=http://lcweb2.loc.gov/cgi-bin/ampage?collId=llhb&fileName=037/llhb037.db&recNum=1985 |title=Bills and Resolutions, House of Representatives, 37th Congress, 2nd Session |publisher=Library of Congress |accessdate=2006-08-04}}</ref>
;March 4, 1863 [[Idaho Territory]] was created from portions of [[Washington Territory|Washington]], [[Dakota Territory|Dakota]], and [[Nebraska Territory|Nebraska]] Territories, consisting of present-day [[Idaho]], [[Montana]], and most of [[Wyoming]]. Nebraska and Washington Territories were left corresponding to their present-day counterparts.<ref>{{cite web |url=http://www.cr.nps.gov/history/online_books/glac/adhi1.htm |title=Glacier National Park – Administrative History |accessdate=2006-08-04 |archiveurl = https://web.archive.org/web/20060504204301/http://www.cr.nps.gov/history/online_books/glac/adhi1.htm <!-- Bot retrieved archive --> |archivedate = 2006-05-04}}</ref>
;June 20, 1863 Several counties of northwestern [[Virginia]] who did not want to be part of the [[Confederate States of America|Confederacy]] split off and were admitted to the US as the 35th state, [[West Virginia]]. {{Clear}}
==1864== [[File:Non-Native American Nations Control over N America 1864.png|180px|right|alt=Map showing Non-Native American Nations Control over N America c. 1864]] ;February 26, 1864 The Mexican state of [[Nuevo León]] was re-split from [[Coahuila]].<ref name="Mexico.statoids"/>
;May 26, 1864 [[Montana Territory]] was split from [[Idaho Territory]], which also had some land transferred to [[Dakota Territory]]. Montana Territory corresponded to present-day [[Montana]], Idaho Territory consisted of [[Idaho]] and western [[Wyoming]], and Dakota Territory included both [[North Dakota|North]] and [[South Dakota]], and most of Wyoming.<ref>{{cite web |url=http://memory.loc.gov/ammem/today/may26.html |title=Today in History: May 26 |publisher=Library of Congress |accessdate=2006-08-04}}</ref>
;October 31, 1864 [[Nevada Territory]] was admitted to the US as the 36th state, [[Nevada]]; it was a bit smaller than it is today, lacking area in both the east and south. {{Clear}}
==1865== [[File:Non-Native American Nations Control over N America 1865.png|180px|right|alt=Map showing Non-Native American Nations Control over N America c. 1865]] ;April 9, 1865 The [[Confederate States of America]] [[Battle of Appomattox Courthouse|surrendered]]. The process of [[Reconstruction era of the United States|Reconstruction]] and readmission to the union would take several years; to simplify the map, they are shown as already readmitted. To view a detailed animated map depicting the various state readmission during Reconstruction see [[:Image:CSA states evolution.gif|CSA states evolution]].
{{Clear}}
==1866== ;August 2, 1866 [[Colony of Vancouver Island]] and [[Colony of British Columbia]] merge to form [[United Colonies of Vancouver Island and British Columbia]] {{Clear}}
==1867== [[File:Non-Native American Nations Control over N America 1867.png|180px|right|alt=Map showing Non-Native American Nations Control over N America c. 1867]] ;January 18, 1867 [[Nevada]]'s eastern border was moved from the 38th [[Washington Meridian|meridian west from Washington]], to the 37th [[Washington Meridian|meridian west from Washington]], transferring land to it from [[Utah Territory]].<ref name="Nevada" /> Also, the northwestern corner of [[Arizona Territory]] was transferred to the state of [[Nevada]], giving it its present-day borders.<ref>{{cite web |url = http://nevadaculture.org/shpo/index.php?option=com_content&task=view&id=314&Itemid=9 |title = Old Boundary, (Nevada's Southern Boundary 1861–1867), Nevada Historical Marker 57 |publisher = Nevada Department of Cultural Affairs |accessdate = 2009-09-01 }}{{Dead link|date=September 2018 |bot=InternetArchiveBot |fix-attempted=yes }}</ref>
;March 1, 1867 [[Nebraska Territory]] was admitted to the US as the 37th state, [[Nebraska]].
;July 1, 1867 [[Canada]] was [[Canadian Confederation|formed from three provinces]] of [[British North America]]: the [[Province of Canada]], which was split into the provinces of [[Ontario]] and [[Quebec]], and the colonies of [[New Brunswick]] and [[Nova Scotia]].<ref name="Atlas of Canada">{{cite web |title = The Atlas of Canada – History of Canada – Territorial Evolution |work = Natural Resources Canada |publisher = Government of Canada |date = 2006-09-02 |url = http://atlas.nrcan.gc.ca/site/english/aboutus/100anniversary/carto_exhibit/terr_evo.html |accessdate = August 22, 2009 |deadurl = yes |archiveurl = https://web.archive.org/web/20120308121255/http://atlas.nrcan.gc.ca/site/english/aboutus/100anniversary/carto_exhibit/terr_evo.html |archivedate = March 8, 2012 |df = }} </ref>
At this time, though, Canada did not become independent according to the modern meaning of the word. The [[Statute of Westminster 1931]] made Canada much closer to being independent, but not completely.
;October 11, 1867 The United States [[Alaska purchase|purchased Alaska]] from [[Russia]]; it was designated the [[Department of Alaska]], and corresponds, except for a [[Alaska Boundary Dispute|boundary dispute]], to present-day [[Alaska]].<ref>{{cite web |url = http://www.yale.edu/lawweb/avalon/diplomacy/russia/treatywi.htm |title = Text of "Treaty concerning the Cession of the Russian Possessions in North America by his Majesty the Emperor of all the Russias to the United States of America" |publisher = The Avalon Project at Yale Law School |accessdate = 2006-08-04 |deadurl = yes |archiveurl = https://web.archive.org/web/20060825094708/http://www.yale.edu/lawweb/avalon/diplomacy/russia/treatywi.htm |archivedate = 2006-08-25 |df = }}</ref> The United States Senate approved the purchase of Alaska from Russia for $7,200,000 (US${{formatnum:{{Inflation|US|7200000|1867|r=2}}}} in {{CURRENTYEAR}}) on April 9, 1867.
{{Clear}}
==1868== [[File:Non-Native American Nations Control over N America 1868.png|180px|right|alt=Map showing Non-Native American Nations Control over N America c. 1868]] ;July 25, 1868 [[Wyoming Territory]] was formed from portions of [[Dakota Territory|Dakota]], [[Idaho Territory|Idaho]], and [[Utah Territory|Utah]] Territories, corresponding to the present-day borders of [[Wyoming]].<ref>{{cite web |url=http://enzi.senate.gov/public/index.cfm?FuseAction=AboutWyoming.WyomingFacts |title=Wyoming Facts |accessdate=2006-08-04}}</ref> Idaho Territory then corresponds to present day Idaho, and Utah Territory to present-day Utah. {{Clear}}
==1869== [[File:Non-Native American Nations Control over N America 1869.png|180px|right|alt=Map showing Non-Native American Nations Control over N America c. 1869]] ;January 15, 1869 The Mexican state of [[Hidalgo (Mexico)|Hidalgo]] was split from the state of [[México (state)|México]].<ref name="Mexico.statoids"/>
;April 16, 1869 The Mexican state of [[Morelos]] was split from the state of [[México (state)|México]].<ref name="Mexico.statoids"/>
{{Clear}}
==July 15, 1870== [[File:Non-Native American Nations Control over N America 1870.png|180px|right|alt=Map showing Non-Native American Nations Control over N America c. 1870]] The [[United Kingdom]] ceded most of its remaining land in [[North America]] to Canada, with [[Rupert's Land]] and the [[North-Western Territory]] becoming the [[Northwest Territories|North-West Territories]]. The [[Rupert's Land Act 1868]] transferred the region to Canada as of 1869, but it was only consummated in 1870 when £300,000 were paid to the [[Hudson's Bay Company]]. At this time, the [[Manitoba Act]] took effect, and a small square of the newly acquired region surrounding the city of [[Winnipeg]] was made the province of [[Manitoba]].<ref>{{cite web | last = Hall | first = David J. | title = North-West Territories, 1870–1905 | work = The Canadian Encyclopedia > History > West & Northwest History | publisher = Historica Foundation of Canada. | year = 2009 | url = http://www.thecanadianencyclopedia.com/index.cfm?PgNm=TCE&Params=A1ARTA0005805 | accessdate = August 22, 2009}} </ref><ref name="E of S">{{cite web | last = Moffat | first = Ben | title = Boundaries of Saskatchewan | work = Encyclopedia of Saskatchewan | publisher =Canadian Plains Research Center, [[University of Regina]] | year = 2006 | url = http://esask.uregina.ca/entry/boundaries_of_saskatchewan.html | doi = | accessdate =August 22, 2009 }} </ref> {{Clear}}
Unlike what this map shows, the actual border between Newfoundland & Quebec is still unknown. Mapmakers have mostly made their own guesses until 1927, pretending that the border was more known than it really was. The problem didn't stop in 1927 (see 1927).
==July 20, 1871== [[File:Non-Native American Nations Control over N America 1871.png|180px|right|alt=Map showing Non-Native American Nations Control over N America c. 1871]] The British [[colony of British Columbia|colony]] of [[British Columbia]] joined Canada as the sixth province.<ref>{{cite web | title = Maps 1667–1999 – Canadian Confederation | work = Library and Archives Canada | publisher = Government of Canada | date = May 2, 2005 | url = http://www.collectionscanada.gc.ca/confederation/023001-2101-e.html |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20080329060918/http://www.collectionscanada.gc.ca/confederation/023001-2101-e.html |archive-date=March 29, 2008 | accessdate = August 22, 2009}} </ref> British Columbia joined the Canadian confederation following The Great Confederation Debates in the spring of 1870 and the Confederation Negotiations of the following summer and winter.<ref>{{cite web |title = British Columbia – Canadian Confederation |work = Library and Archives Canada |publisher = Government of Canada |date = August 9, 2006 |url = http://www.collectionscanada.gc.ca/confederation/023001-2185-e.html |accessdate = August 22, 2009 |deadurl = yes |archiveurl = https://web.archive.org/web/20080621230955/http://www.collectionscanada.gc.ca/confederation/023001-2185-e.html |archivedate = June 21, 2008 |df = }} </ref> {{Clear}}
==October 21, 1872== [[File:Non-Native American Nations Control over N America 1872.png|180px|right|alt=Map showing Non-Native American Nations Control over N America c. 1872]] The [[San Juan Islands]] were awarded to the US, formally ending the [[Pig War (1859)|Pig War]] with Britain.<ref name="Barman p. 76">{{harvnb|Barman|1996|p=76}}</ref> {{Clear}}
==July 1, 1873== [[File:Non-Native American Nations Control over N America 1873.png|180px|right|alt=Map showing Non-Native American Nations Control over N America c. 1873]] The British colony of [[Prince Edward Island]] joined Canada as the seventh province by an Act of Parliament (and, as part of the terms of union, was guaranteed a [[ferry]] link, a term which was deleted upon completion of the [[Confederation Bridge]] in 1997).<ref>{{cite web | last = Bolger | first = Francis William Pius | title = Prince Edward Island and Confederation 1863–1873 | work = St. Dunstan's University, Charlottetwon CCHA Report 28 (1961) 25–30 | publisher = University of Manitoba | year = 1961 | url = http://www.umanitoba.ca/colleges/st_pauls/ccha/Back%20Issues/CCHA1961/Bolger.pdf | format = PDF | accessdate =August 22, 2009 }} </ref> {{Clear}}
==July 26, 1874== [[File:Non-Native American Nations Control over N America 1874.png|180px|right|alt=Map showing Non-Native American Nations Control over N America c. 1874]] The borders of [[Ontario]] were provisionally expanded north and west. When the Province of Canada was formed, its borders were not entirely clear, and Ontario claimed to eventually reach all the way to the [[Rocky Mountains]] and [[Arctic Ocean]]. With Canada's acquisition of [[Rupert's Land]], Ontario was interested in clearly defining its borders, especially since some of the new areas it was interested in were rapidly growing. After the federal government asked Ontario to pay for construction in the new disputed area, the province asked for an elaboration on its limits, and its boundary was moved north to the [[51st parallel north]].<ref name="Mills p. 347">{{harvnb|Mills|1877|p=347}}</ref><ref>{{cite web |title = Territorial Evolution, 1874 |work = Natural Resources Canada > Atlas Home > Explore Our Maps > History > Territorial Evolution > Territorial Evolution, 1874 |publisher = Government of Canada |date = March 18, 2009 |url = http://atlas.nrcan.gc.ca/site/english/maps/historical/territorialevolution/1874/1 |accessdate = August 22, 2009 |deadurl = yes |archiveurl = https://web.archive.org/web/20090618033543/http://atlas.nrcan.gc.ca/site/english/maps/historical/territorialevolution/1874/1 |archivedate = June 18, 2009 |df = }} </ref> {{Clear}}
==1876== [[File:Non-Native American Nations Control over N America 1876.png|180px|right|alt=Map showing Non-Native American Nations Control over N America c. 1876]] ;April 12, 1876 The [[District of Keewatin]] was created by the passage of the ''Keewatin Act'' on April 12, 1876 in a central separate strip from the [[Northwest Territories|North-West Territories]], in order to provide government for the growing area north of [[Manitoba]] and west of [[Ontario]].<ref name="Manitoba p. 3">[[#refManitoba1876|Manitoba 1876]], p. 3.</ref><ref name="Manitoba p. 1">[[#refManitoba1876.2|Manitoba 1876]], p. 1.</ref>
;August 1, 1876 [[Colorado Territory]] was admitted to the US as the 38th state, [[Colorado]]. {{Clear}}
==February 8, 1879== Arenas Key is claimed for the United States under the [[Guano Islands Act]] {{Clear}}
==1880== [[File:Non-Native American Nations Control over N America 1880.png|180px|right|alt=Map showing Non-Native American Nations Control over N America c. 1880]] ;September 1, 1880 The [[United Kingdom]] ceded its [[British Arctic Territories|Arctic Islands]] to Canada,<ref>[[s:Adjacent Territories Order|''Adjacent Territories Order'']]</ref> and they were made part of the [[Northwest Territories|North-West Territories]].<ref name="Atlas of Canada Islands">{{cite web |title = The Atlas of Canada – History of Canada – Territorial Evolution 1880 |work = Natural Resources Canada |publisher = Government of Canada |date = 2006-09-02 |url = http://atlas.nrcan.gc.ca/site/english/maps/historical/territorialevolution/1880/1 |accessdate = August 22, 2009 |deadurl = yes |archiveurl = https://web.archive.org/web/20090617000617/http://atlas.nrcan.gc.ca/site/english/maps/historical/territorialevolution/1880/1 |archivedate = June 17, 2009 |df = }} </ref> ;September 13, 1880 The Western Triangle Islands are claimed for the United States under the Guano Islands Act. {{Clear}}
==July 1, 1881== [[File:Non-Native American Nations Control over N America 1881.png|180px|right|alt=Map showing Non-Native American Nations Control over N America c. 1881]] [[Manitoba]]'s borders were expanded to a larger ''postage stamp province'' taking land easterly from the [[District of Keewatin]] to the western boundary of Ontario. Since the province's eastern border was defined as the "western boundary of [[Ontario]]", the exact definition of which was still unclear, Ontario disputed a portion of the new region.<ref>{{cite web | url=http://www.amls.ca/Manitoba.htm | archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20070722122047/http://www.amls.ca/Manitoba.htm | archivedate=2007-07-22 | title=Manitoba's Boundaries | publisher=Association of Manitoba Land Surveyors | accessdate=August 18, 2009}}</ref> {{Clear}}
==March 28, 1882== [[File:Non-Native American Nations Control over N America 1882.png|180px|right|alt=Map showing Non-Native American Nations Control over N America March 28, 1882]] The part of [[Dakota Territory]] south of 43° north and north of the [[Keya Paha River|Keya Paha]] and [[Niobrara River|Niobrara]] Rivers was transferred to [[Nebraska]].<ref name="Hansen p. 122">{{harvnb|Hansen|2007|p=122}}</ref> {{Clear}}
==1884== [[File:Non-Native American Nations Control over N America 1884.png|180px|right|alt=Map showing Non-Native American Nations Control over N America c. 1884]]
;June 21, 1884 The Islands of Perez Chica and Pajora of the Alacrene Islands in the bay of Campeche are claimed for the United States under the [[Guano Islands Act]].
;December 12, 1884 The Mexican territory of [[Tepic]] was split from the state of [[Jalisco]].<ref name="Mexico.statoids"/> {{Clear}}
==May 7, 1886== [[File:Non-Native American Nations Control over N America 1886.png|180px|right|alt=Map showing Non-Native American Nations Control over N America c. 1886]] The southwestern border of the [[District of Keewatin]] was adjusted to conform to the boundaries of the new [[districts of the Northwest Territories|provisional districts of the North-West Territories]] created in 1882, returning some land to the [[Northwest Territories|North-West Territories]].<ref name="Canada p. 36 ">{{harvnb|Canada|1893|p=36 }}</ref> The provisional districts were the [[District of Alberta]], the [[District of Athabasca]], [[Assiniboia#District of Assiniboia|District of Assiniboia]] and the [[District of Saskatchewan]], which all remained administrative areas of the North-West Territories, unlike the [[District of Keewatin]].<ref name="E of S"/> {{Clear}}
==1889== [[File:Non-Native American Nations Control over N America 1889.png|180px|right|alt=Map showing Non-Native American Nations Control over N America c. 1889]] ;November 2, 1889 [[Dakota Territory]] was split in two, and it was admitted to the US as the 39th state, [[North Dakota]], and 40th state, [[South Dakota]].
;November 8, 1889 [[Montana Territory]] was admitted to the US as the 41st state, [[Montana]]. ;November 11, 1889 [[Washington Territory]] was admitted to the US as the 42nd state, [[Washington (state)|Washington]]. ;August 12, 1889 The dispute between [[Manitoba]] and [[Ontario]] ended as Ontario's borders were finalized in accordance with the Canada (Ontario Boundary) Act, 1889, which extended the province west to the [[Lake of the Woods]] and north to the [[Albany River]].<ref>{{cite wikisource|title=Canada (Ontario Boundary) Act|wslink=Canada (Ontario Boundary) Act 1889}}</ref> {{Clear}}
==1890== [[File:Non-Native American Nations Control over N America 1890.png|180px|right|alt=Map showing Non-Native American Nations Control over N America c. 1890]] ;May 2, 1890 [[Oklahoma Territory]] was organized from the western portion of [[Indian Territory]], and included the [[Neutral Strip (Oklahoma)|Neutral Strip]], corresponding to the western half of present-day [[Oklahoma]].<ref>{{cite web |url=http://www.odl.state.ok.us/oar/resources/territorialgov.htm |title=Papers of the Territorial Governors |accessdate=2006-08-04}}</ref> ;July 3, 1890 [[Idaho Territory]] was admitted to the US as the 43rd state, [[Idaho]]. ;July 10, 1890 [[Wyoming Territory]] was admitted to the US as the 44th state, [[Wyoming]]. {{Clear}}
==November 24, 1894== The American claims over the Western Triangle, Areaas, Perez, Chica, Pajoras, and Arenas Keys are all waived by the American government in favor of Mexico.
==October 2, 1895== [[File:Non-Native American Nations Control over N America 1895.png|180px|right|alt=Map showing Non-Native American Nations Control over N America c. 1895]] Keewatin covered the portion of the North-West Territories north of [[Manitoba]] on the mainland, and all islands within Hudson, James, and Ungava Bays. The portion between the [[District of Keewatin]], [[Ontario]], and [[Hudson Bay]] was not in a district, and was assigned to the District of Keewatin by an Order of Council. Four additional provisional [[districts of the Northwest Territories|districts of the North-West Territories]] were formed, the [[History of Yukon|District of Yukon]], the [[District of Ungava]], the [[District of Mackenzie]], and the [[District of Franklin]].<ref name="Martin p. 223">[[#refMartin1899|Martin 1899]], p. 223.</ref><ref name="Atlas of Canada 1895">{{cite web |title = The Atlas of Canada – History of Canada – Territorial Evolution 1895 |work = Natural Resources Canada |publisher = Government of Canada |date = 2006-09-02 |url = http://atlas.nrcan.gc.ca/site/english/maps/historical/territorialevolution/1895/1 |accessdate = August 22, 2009 |deadurl = yes |archiveurl = https://web.archive.org/web/20090713055633/http://atlas.nrcan.gc.ca/site/english/maps/historical/territorialevolution/1895/1 |archivedate = July 13, 2009 |df = }} </ref> {{Clear}}
==1896== [[File:Non-Native American Nations Control over N America 1896.png|180px|right|alt=Map showing Non-Native American Nations Control over N America c. 1896]] ;January 4, 1896 [[Utah Territory]] was admitted to the US as the 45th state, [[Utah]].
;May 4, 1896 A [[Supreme Court of the United States|Supreme Court]] ruling officially assigns [[Greer County, Texas|Greer County]] to [[Oklahoma Territory]].<ref>{{cite web |url=http://digital.library.okstate.edu/chronicles/v012/v012p145.html |title=Chronicles of Oklahoma, Volume 12, No. 2, June, 1934: GREER COUNTY |accessdate=2006-08-04}}</ref> {{Clear}}
==1897== The borders of the [[District of Keewatin]] were adjusted.<ref name="Atlas of Canada 1897">{{cite web |title = The Atlas of Canada – History of Canada – Territorial Evolution 1897 |work = Natural Resources Canada |publisher = Government of Canada |date = 2006-09-02 |url = http://atlas.nrcan.gc.ca/site/english/maps/historical/territorialevolution/1895/1 |accessdate = August 22, 2009 |deadurl = yes |archiveurl = https://web.archive.org/web/20090713055633/http://atlas.nrcan.gc.ca/site/english/maps/historical/territorialevolution/1895/1 |archivedate = July 13, 2009 |df = }} </ref> [[Southampton Island]], [[Coats Island]], [[Mansel Island]], [[Akimiski Island]], and other islands were transferred to Keewatin. {{#tag:ref|Not shown on the map as maritime borders are not displayed |group="A"}} {{Clear}}
==June 13, 1898== [[File:Non-Native American Nations Control over N America 1898.png|180px|right|alt=Map showing Non-Native American Nations Control over N America c. 1898]] [[Yukon Territory]] was created from the District of Yukon in the northwestern part of the [[Northwest Territories|North-West Territories]], and the [[Quebec Boundary Extension Act, 1898]] expanded the borders of [[Quebec]] north to the [[Eastmain River]].<ref>{{cite wikisource|wslink=Quebec Boundary Extension Act, 1898|title=Quebec Boundary Extension Act|year=1898}}</ref>
{{Clear}}
==May 23, 1901== [[File:Non-Native American Nations Control over N America 1901.png|180px|right|alt=Map showing Non-Native American Nations Control over N America c. 1901]] The eastern border of [[Yukon Territory]] was adjusted to the eastern edge of the [[Peel River (Canada)|Peel River]] watershed, and also to include some more islands.<ref>{{Cite canlaw |short title = Yukon Territory Act |abbr = S.C. |year = 1901 |chapter = 41 |section = 14 |link = https://books.google.com/books?id=Vg8vAAAAIAAJ&pg=PA174&dq=yukon+territory+boundary+1901+peel&lr=&ei=4atbSou_AoKaMoPTtZAH&client=firefox-a |linkloc = Google Books }}</ref> {{Clear}}
==November 24, 1902== [[File:Non-Native American Nations Control over N America 1902.png|180px|right|alt=Map showing Non-Native American Nations Control over N America c. 1902]] The Mexican territory of [[Quintana Roo]] was split from the state of [[Yucatán (state)|Yucatán]].<ref name="Mexico.statoids"/> {{Clear}}
==1903== [[File:Non-Native American Nations Control over N America 1903.png|180px|right|alt=Map showing Non-Native American Nations Control over N America c. 1903]] The [[Alaska Boundary Dispute]] was a territorial dispute between the United States and Canada (then a British Dominion with its foreign affairs controlled from London), and at a subnational level between Alaska on the US side and British Columbia and the Yukon on the Canadian side. It was resolved by arbitration in 1903, generally favoring the American claim.<ref name="D.M.L.FARR">{{cite web |year=2007 |url = http://www.thecanadianencyclopedia.com/index.cfm?PgNm=TCE&Params=A1ARTA0000107|title = Alaska Boundary Dispute|publisher = The Canadian Encyclopedia © 2009 Historica Foundation of Canada.| accessdate = 2009-05-02 | last=D.M.L. FARR |quote=}}</ref> {{Clear}}
==September 1, 1905== [[File:Non-Native American Nations Control over N America 1905.png|180px|right|alt=Map showing Non-Native American Nations Control over N America c. 1905]] The provinces of [[Alberta]] and [[Saskatchewan]] were created from the [[Northwest Territories|North-West Territories]]. Saskatchewan's western border and Alberta's eastern border run concurrent with the 4th meridian{{Ref label|Meridian|A|A}} or the 110°W longitude. Saskatchewan's eastern border is not a meridian, but instead follows a staircase-shaped [[Dominion Land Survey]] range line. Alberta's southern and northern borders are the same as Saskatchewan's: the southern border is the [[Canada–United States border]] or the [[49th parallel north|49th parallel]] and the northern border is the [[60th parallel north|60th parallel]]. Alberta's western border runs along peaks of the [[Rocky Mountain]] ridge and then extends north to the 60th parallel.<ref name="Widdis">{{cite journal | last = Thomson | first = Malcolm M. | authorlink = |author2=Tanner, Richard W. | title = Canada's Prime Meridian | journal = Journal of the Royal Astronomical Society of Canada | volume = 71 | page = 204 | publisher = | location = | date = April 1977 | id = 1977JRASC..71..204T | accessdate = January 6, 2009}} </ref><ref name="Widdis_Sask">{{cite web | last = Widdis | first = Randy | title = 49th Parallel | work = The Encyclopedia of Saskatchewan | publisher = Canadian Plains Research Center, University of Regina | year = 2006 | url = http://esask.uregina.ca/entry/49th_parallel.html | accessdate = January 6, 2009}} </ref><ref name="Lewry">{{cite web | last = Lewry | first = Marilyn | title = Boundary surveys | work = The Encyclopedia of Saskatchewan | publisher = Canadian Plains Research Center, University of Regina | year = 2006 | url = http://esask.uregina.ca/entry/boundary_surveys.html | accessdate = January 6, 2009}} </ref><ref name="Atlas">{{cite web |title = The Atlas of Canada – Territorial Evolution, 1905 |work = Natural Resources Canada |publisher = Government of Canada |date = April 6, 2004 |url = http://atlas.nrcan.gc.ca/site/english/maps/historical/territorialevolution/1905/1 |accessdate = January 6, 2009 |deadurl = yes |archiveurl = https://web.archive.org/web/20081212001951/http://atlas.nrcan.gc.ca/site/english/maps/historical/territorialevolution/1905/1 |archivedate = December 12, 2008 |df = }} </ref> The [[District of Keewatin]] became an administrative unit of the Northwest Territories. {{Clear}}
==1906== [[File:Non-Native American Nations Control over N America 1906.png|180px|right|alt=Map showing Non-Native American Nations Control over N America c. 1906]] In 1906, the American Rio Grande Land and Irrigation Company performed an unauthorized diversion of the [[Rio Grande]], which moved a {{convert|413|acre|adj=on}} tract of land, including the American village of [[Rio Rico, Tamaulipas|Rio Rico]], south of the river. Since the 1845 Border Treaty all land south of the Rio Grande was Mexican. Mexican authorities unknowingly assumed control of the area, which became known as the '''[[Horcón Tract]]'''.<ref name="tomesparza.com">{{cite web|year = 2009|url = http://www.tomesparza.com/wp-content/uploads/2009/09/RioRico.pdf|title = The Strange case of Rio Rico|format = PDF|publisher = tomesparza.com|accessdate = December 31, 2009|last = |quote = |deadurl = yes|archiveurl = https://web.archive.org/web/20101227023826/http://www.tomesparza.com/wp-content/uploads/2009/09/RioRico.pdf|archivedate = December 27, 2010|df = }}</ref> {{Clear}}
==1907== [[File:Non-Native American Nations Control over N America 1907.png|180px|right|alt=Map showing Non-Native American Nations Control over N America c. 1907]] ;September 26, 1907 The [[Dominion of Newfoundland]] was a [[Dominion|British dominion]] from 1907 (before which the territory had the status of a [[United Kingdom|British]] colony, self-governing from 1855) to 1949. The Dominion of Newfoundland was situated in northeastern [[North America]] along the [[Atlantic Ocean|Atlantic]] coast and comprised the [[Newfoundland (island)|island of Newfoundland]] and [[Labrador]] on the mainland.<ref name="comm">{{cite web | last =Webb | first =Jeff A. | title =The Commission of Government, 1934–1949 | publisher =Newfoundland and Labrador Heritage Web Site (2007) |date=January 2003 | url =http://www.heritage.nf.ca/law/commission_gov.html | accessdate = 2007-08-10 }}</ref>
Newfoundland never became independent according to the modern meaning of the word. The [[Statute of Westminster 1931]] would have made Newfoundland much closer to being independent, but not completely. However, the government of Newfoundland did not ratify it, and furthermore, abolished itself in 1934 because of bankruptcy.
;November 16, 1907 [[Oklahoma Territory]] and [[Indian Territory]] were combined and admitted to the US as the 46th state, [[Oklahoma]]. {{Clear}}
==1912== [[File:Non-Native American Nations Control over N America 1912.png|180px|right|alt=Map showing Non-Native American Nations Control over N America c. 1912]] ;January 6, 1912 [[New Mexico Territory]] was admitted to the US as the 47th state, [[New Mexico]]. ;February 14, 1912 [[Arizona Territory]] was admitted to the US as the 48th state, [[Arizona]].
;May 15, 1912 [[Manitoba]], [[Ontario]], and [[Quebec]] were all expanded into their present-day boundaries. The Northwest Territories is now only situated north of the [[60th parallel north|60th parallel]] (except Hudson Bay and James Bay islands) with three districts, Keewatin, Mackenzie and Franklin.<ref name="international p. 130">{{harvnb|international|1914|p=130}}</ref>
{{Clear}}
==February 5, 1917== [[File:Non-Native American Nations Control over N America 1917.png|180px|right|alt=Map showing Non-Native American Nations Control over N America c. 1917]] With the promulgation of the [[Constitution of Mexico|1917 Constitution of Mexico]], the territory of [[Tepic]] had its name and status changed to the state of [[Nayarit]].<ref name="Mexico.statoids"/> {{Clear}}
==March 28, 1921== [[File:Non-Native American Nations Control over N America 1921.png|180px|right|alt=Map showing Non-Native American Nations Control over N America March 28, 1921]] The dispute over a square mile between [[Delaware]] and [[Pennsylvania]], [[The Wedge (border)|The Wedge]], is finally resolved in favor of Delaware.<ref>{{cite web |url=http://ucblibraries.colorado.edu/govpubs/conference/handouts/Erie/Erie.ppt |title=The Erie Triangle |format=PPT |accessdate=2007-08-01 |deadurl=yes |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20060911223557/http://ucblibraries.colorado.edu/govpubs/conference/handouts/Erie/Erie.ppt |archivedate=2006-09-11 |df= }}</ref> {{Clear}}
==March 11, 1927== [[File:Non-Native American Nations Control over N America 1927.png|180px|right|alt=Map showing Non-Native American Nations Control over N America c. 1927]] A decision of the [[Judicial Committee of the Privy Council|Judicial Committee]] of the [[United Kingdom|British]] Privy Council of 1927 decided the [[Labrador#The Labrador boundary dispute|issue]] of the border between the [[Dominion of Newfoundland]] and [[Canada]] in favour of Newfoundland. The issue had been the precise boundary between the Canadian province of [[Quebec]] and [[Labrador]], part of Newfoundland. The boundary ruling clarified that a large area of the disputed land belonged to Newfoundland, not to Canada.<ref>[[Labrador boundary dispute|Labrador Boundary Dispute]]</ref><ref>{{cite web | title = Les Dix Grand Mensonges | work = Henri Dorion discrédite les Dix Grand Mensonges sur la frontière du Labrador (Henri Dorion debunks the Ten Great Myths about the Labrador boundary) | publisher = Québec—Assemblée Nationale—Première session, 34<sup>e</sup> Législature (Quebec—National Assembly—First Session, 34th Legislature) | date = October 1, 1991 | url = http://www.geocities.com/Yosemite/Rapids/3330/constitution/hdfr.htm | archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20090805164734/http://geocities.com/Yosemite/Rapids/3330/constitution/hdfr.htm | archivedate=2009-08-05 | accessdate = August 25, 2009}} </ref> {{Clear}}
Maps prior to 1927 wildly disagreed on the actual position of the border, instead of agreeing upon marking the area as being disputed. Maps after 1927 tended to agree with the decision, but due to protests, some mapmakers in [[Quebec]] still disagreed. In the 60's, logos of the two biggest political parties of Quebec (PLQ & UN) both included the shape of the province as including ''all'' of Labrador. Disagreements persist even today (to a lesser extent), as Quebec insists on including the rest of the gulf's basin in its maps, separated with a dotted line saying ''1927 border, non-final''.<ref>http://www.electionsquebec.qc.ca/images/carte-2011/circonscriptions/745.gif</ref> Newfoundland complains in 2014,<ref>http://globalnews.ca/news/1257709/quebec-election-map-revives-controversy-over-labrador-border-dispute/</ref> even though older electoral maps showed the same.
==1928== [[File:Non-Native American Nations Control over N America 1928.png|180px|right|alt=Map showing Non-Native American Nations Control over N America c. 1928]] [[Norway]] asserted its claim of sovereignty over the [[Sverdrup Islands]]. The islands are named after Norwegian explorer [[Otto Sverdrup]], who explored and mapped them from 1898 to 1902 with the vessel ''[[Fram]]'', although some were previously inhabited by [[Inuit]] people. Sverdrup claimed the islands for Norway, but the Norwegian government showed no interest in pursuing the claim until 1928. At that point, the Norwegian government raised the claim, primarily to use the islands as bargaining chips in negotiations with the [[United Kingdom]] over the status of the Arctic island [[Jan Mayen]] and the Antarctic [[Bouvet Island]].<ref name="Berton p. 629">{{harvnb|Berton|1988|p=629}}</ref> {{Clear}}
==November 11, 1930== [[File:Non-Native American Nations Control over N America 1930.png|180px|right|alt=Map showing Non-Native American Nations Control over N America c. 1930]] [[Sverdrup Islands]] are ceded to Canada by Norway, in exchange for British recognition of Norway's sovereignty over [[Jan Mayen]].<ref name="Berton p. 629"/>
{{Clear}}
==February 7, 1931== [[File:Non-Native American Nations Control over N America 1931.png|180px|right|alt=Map showing Non-Native American Nations Control over N America c. 1931]] The Mexican [[Baja California Territory]] was split into [[Baja California|North Territory of Baja California]] and [[Baja California Sur|South Territory of Baja California]].<ref name="Mexico.statoids"/> {{Clear}}
[[Statute of Westminster 1931]] allows dominions to become independent. Dominion of Canada decides to become almost independent, whereas Newfoundland does not sign (see 1934).
==1934== [[File:Non-Native American Nations Control over N America 1934.png|180px|right|alt=Map showing Non-Native American Nations Control over N America c. 1934]]
The [[Dominion of Newfoundland]], because of financial difficulties, was obliged to give up its self-governing status and the Commission of Government took its place.<ref name="heritage.nf.ca"/> {{Clear}}
==1948== [[Air Force Island]], [[Prince Charles Island]], and [[Foley Island]] are discovered and added to Northwest Territories. {{Clear}}
==March 31, 1949== [[File:Non-Native American Nations Control over N America 1949.png|180px|right|alt=Map showing Non-Native American Nations Control over N America c. 1949]] The [[Dominion of Newfoundland]] and its dependency of [[Labrador]] joined Canada as the tenth [[Provinces and territories of Canada|province]], named [[Newfoundland and Labrador|Newfoundland]] as proclaimed by the [[British North America Acts#British North America Act, 1949|British North America Act 1949]].<ref name="heritage.nf.ca">{{cite web | last = Webb | first = Jeff A. | title = The Commission of Government, 1934–1949: Newfoundland and Labrador Heritage | publisher = Memorial University of Newfoundland and the C.R.B. Foundation. | date = January 2003 | url = http://www.heritage.nf.ca/law/commission_gov.html | accessdate =August 25, 2009 }} </ref> {{Clear}}
==November 21, 1952== [[File:Non-Native American Nations Control over N America 1952.png|180px|right|alt=Map showing Non-Native American Nations Control over N America c. 1952]] The ''North Territory of Baja California'' changed its status and became the state of [[Baja California]].<ref name="Mexico.statoids"/> {{Clear}}
==1959== [[File:Non-Native American Nations Control over N America 1959.png|180px|right|alt=Map showing Non-Native American Nations Control over N America c. 1959]] ;January 3, 1959 [[Alaska Territory]] was admitted to the US as the 49th state, [[Alaska]]. {{Clear}}
==1970== [[File:Non-Native American Nations Control over N America 1970.png|180px|right|alt=Map showing Non-Native American Nations Control over N America c. 1970]] The city of [[Rio Rico, Texas]], was ceded to [[Mexico]] in the [[Boundary Treaty of 1970]]. The handover officially took place in 1977 and the city was added to the [[Mexican state]] of [[Tamaulipas]].<ref name="Miller pp. 13-21">{{harvnb|Miller|1981| pp=13–21}}</ref> {{Clear}}
==October 8, 1974== [[File:Non-Native American Nations Control over N America 1974.png|180px|right|alt=Map showing Non-Native American Nations Control over N America c. 1974]] The territory of [[Quintana Roo]] changed into a state status. The ''South Territory of Baja California'' changed its status and became the state of [[Baja California Sur]], giving Mexico its present-day configuration.<ref name="Mexico.statoids"/> {{Clear}}
==April 1, 1999== [[File:Non-Native American Nations Control over N America 1999.png|180px|right|alt=Map showing Non-Native American Nations Control over N America c. 1999]] The Canadian territory of [[Nunavut]] was created from the [[Northwest Territories]]. The provisional districts are no longer administrative areas of the Northwest Territories.<ref name="csmonitor.nunavut">{{cite web|date = April 1, 1999|url = http://www.csmonitor.com/centennial/on-this-day/2009/04/april-1-1999-nunavut-becomes-the-newest-largest-territory-in-canada/|title = Nunavut becomes the newest, largest territory in Canada|publisher = [[The Christian Science Monitor]]|accessdate = November 14, 2009|last = Walker, Ruth|quote = |archive-url = https://web.archive.org/web/20091106002434/http://www.csmonitor.com/centennial/on-this-day/2009/04/april-1-1999-nunavut-becomes-the-newest-largest-territory-in-canada/|archive-date = 2009-11-06|dead-url = yes|df = }}</ref> {{Clear}}
